recipe.title: Nut-Free Vegan Tahini Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 250g white beans, rinsed and with water squeezed out
3/4 cup vegan dark chocolate chips or chopped chocolate
steps: Rinse and drain the white beans well, then squeeze water out of them dry with paper towels. Then weigh 250g.
In a food processor, blend all ingredients except the chocolate chips until completely smooth, scraping down the sides as needed.
Transfer the batter to a bowl and fold in the chocolate chips.
Chill the dough in the fridge for 60 minutes to help the cookies hold their shape.
Scoop the dough onto a lined baking sheet using a small ice cream scoop or tablespoon, spacing them apart.
Add extra chocolate chips on top if you like.
Bake for 17–19 minutes, or until lightly golden bits appear on top.
Let them cool on the baking tray for 10–15 minutes before carefully transferring to a wire rack to cool overnight to set firmly.
